list-item.p: Dressings of wounds: A mixture of calcium alginate with sodium serves as an effective remedy for alginate dressing for the closure of wounds and haemostasis. They help in providing a moist condition at the site of wound achieving haemostasis and absorbing exudates [ 109]. They also aid in reduction of wound pain, decrease the biological burden of the wounded site, and absorb proteinases for reducing the odour [ 110]. Alginate-associated wound dressings include strategies such as electrospun mats, hydrogels, and sponges, offering numerous advantages, like gel-forming capability on absorbing wound exudates leading to haemostasis [ 111].
Drug delivery system: Alginate potentially acts as a carrier for immobilization and encapsulation of drugs due to its biodegradability and biocompatibility [ 106].
